intro: Dianthus caryophyllus var. transiens, commonly known as the transiens carnation, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm and features upright stems with narrow, linear leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from spring to early autumn.
